qandaentry.xreflabel: How to use a slightly modified stylesheet

question.para: How can I use a slightly modified generic stylesheet?
There are multiple stylesheets with numerous parameters, but I simply want to modified some of them. I cannot touch the original document because it's being shared by a pool of authors.
How can I still re-use most of the definitions and override some of them?

answer.para: ADA offers this possibility by allowing a set of stylesheets to be merged with the a given style file. These files are defined as a space separated list in the variable mergestyles.master.style.

Suppose you want to use the style file in ${ada.home}/ADA_Styles/HeadTail.xsl to generate an HTML page. To reuse those definitions and override some of them, create a local stylesheet (for example, a file with name MyPersonalValues.xml) containing only the definitions you want to override. The resulting applied style sheet is a file left in the current directory with name MyPersonalValues_ADA_MERGED_STYLE.xsl.
